newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Q1 chemical trade gap widens - association.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Q1 chemical trade gap widens - association.

text.p: Mexico is still importing more chemicals and petrochemicals than it produces, with first-quarter exports valued at $807 million and imports at $1.5 billion, the National Chemical Industry Association (ANIQ) said on Wednesday.
The nation's deficit in chemical trade rose by 73.7 percent from the year-ago period, the association said.
Total first-quarter exports were 1.20 million tonnes compared with imports of 1.61 million tonnes, the association said, citing Trade Ministry figures in a recent report.
"We expect that by the end of 1997 exports will reach $3.2 billion and imports will be $6 billion," the association wrote.
The group's quarterly report is based on a questionnaire sent to 125 of its members.
